question.text:
(i) Mitochondria and chloroplast possess small and circular non-histone DNA.

(ii) Mesosomes are extension of plasma membrane.

(iii) Quasi fluid nature of lipid enables flip flop movement of proteins at a specific place.

(iv) Components of endomembrane system associated with secretion, packaging of material and capable of digestion of several macro organic compounds.

From given, incorrect statement is/are

solution.text: The quasi fluid nature of the lipid helps in the lateral movement of protein through the membrane bilayer. The protein can move through the membrane and not only at specific places. Mitochondria and plastid are semi-autonomous organelle as they have DNA similar to bacteria and partially depend on nucleus. Endomembrane system comprises of ER, Golgi, vacuole, lysosome, etc.
